summary: Build 'LIA' — a desktop (and mobile-friendly UI) voice assistant/virtual concierge with natural conversation, Hindi-first female voice, long-term memory, extensible tool integrations (incl. MCP), and capabilities for app/web control, media playback, camera-based interactions, and social messaging/posting automation.
architectural_notes: Do not embed or request third-party 'free' API keys; require user-provided keys and secure storage.
Social automation and device-control features may require platform-specific permissions and may be restricted by third-party TOS; design with explicit user consent and modular capability toggles.

existing_features.title: Create a mobile-friendly web UI for a voice assistant named “LIA” with a clear chat layout (messages, input, mic control) and assistant persona details: assistant name shown as “LIA”, and the user addressed as “Mj”.

Implement browser-based Hindi-first speech features: (a) speech-to-text using the Web Speech API (or best-available browser API) with Hindi as the default recognition language, and (b) text-to-speech using the browser TTS voices with a female voice preference when available; provide settings to switch language/voice but default to Hindi.

Add persistent conversation memory across sessions: store conversation history in the Motoko backend per authenticated user (Internet Identity), and load recent conversation context when the user returns.

Provide a simple “concierge tools” framework that lets LIA invoke built-in tools based on explicit user commands (no third-party LLM): include at minimum (1) web search on demand, (2) open a website URL, (3) play a YouTube video by opening a YouTube search/query link, and (4) a basic “help” command that lists available tools and examples.

Implement an extensible custom-tool registry UI for adding simple user-defined tools (name + description + URL template) that LIA can run via explicit commands; store these tool definitions per user in the backend.
Add an anime-style LIA avatar to the UI with speaking/listening states (e.g., idle vs. talking) using generated static assets; the avatar must not be photorealistic.

Add an in-browser camera preview panel so the user can see themselves (with permission), alongside the avatar; include basic controls for start/stop camera and camera selection if multiple devices are available.

Ensure “auto-start when opening the website” behavior within browser constraints: on first visit, show a single call-to-action to enable microphone (and optionally camera); after user enables, subsequent visits auto-initialize LIA UI and restore the last session without showing any activity log screen.

Apply one coherent, distinctive visual theme (colors, typography, layout) appropriate for a “virtual concierge” assistant, and use it consistently across all pages/components; avoid blue+purple as the primary palette.
Ensure LIA reliably speaks (text-to-speech) only for newly generated assistant responses, not when conversation history is initially loaded/restored.

If the browser does not support Speech Synthesis, surface a clear, non-blocking message in Settings indicating that voice output is unavailable in the current browser, while keeping the rest of the app functional.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create LIA desktop voice assistant persona (female voice/name 'LIA') with user nickname 'Mj' and natural conversational interaction
Add long-term memory and conversation context across past sessions
Implement web search on demand and general concierge utilities (basic Q&A, info lookup)
Provide extensible tool/integration framework (custom tools + MCP tools)
Hindi language support with Hindi as default and high-quality Hindi TTS/voice
System control features: open any app, open websites, play YouTube videos, play music/sing song features
Camera features: enable camera view so LIA can 'see' user and user can see themselves; add camera improvements
Add anime girl model/avatar UI for LIA
Make UI mobile-friendly and auto-start/auto-open assistant when opening its website; background 'wake word' style behavior (e.g., 'Hey Google')
Phone management features (manage phone, access gallery photos/videos)
Social automation: auto message on Instagram/WhatsApp; auto post images/videos to Instagram
LLM provider integration: add Gemini API support (user requested 'free API key')
Self-healing: detect and auto-fix errors where possible
Enable voice output so LIA speaks responses (text-to-speech playback in the assistant UI)
